a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "x = sqrt 1000000"
and h1 : "y = 1000000 powr (1/3)"
shows  "x - y = 900"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of $\sqrt{1,\!000,\!000} - \sqrt[3]{1,\!000,\!000}$? The final Answer is 900
 ### Proof
 We have   \begin{align} \sqrt{1,\!000,\!000} - \sqrt[3]{1,\!000,\!000}&= \sqrt{10^6} - \sqrt[3]{10^6} \\ &= (10^6)^{\frac{1}{2}} - (10^6)^{\frac{1}{3}}\\ &=10^{6\cdot \frac{1}{2}} - 10^{6\cdot \frac{1}{3}} \\
 &= 10^3 - 10^2 = 1000-100 =\boxed{900}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "x = sqrt 1000000"
and h1 : "y = 1000000 powr (1/3)"
shows  "x - y = 900"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the difference between the square root of 1,000,000 and the cube root of 1,000,000. The final answer is 900.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a = sqrt 1000000"
and h1 : "b = (1000000 powr (1/3))"
shows  "a - b = 900"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of $\sqrt{1,\!000,\!000} - \sqrt[3]{1,\!000,\!000}$? The final Answer is 900
 ### Proof
 We have   \begin{align} \sqrt{1,\!000,\!000} - \sqrt[3]{1,\!000,\!000}&= \sqrt{10^6} - \sqrt[3]{10^6} \\ &= (10^6)^{\frac{1}{2}} - (10^6)^{\frac{1}{3}}\\ &=10^{6\cdot \frac{1}{2}} - 10^{6\cdot \frac{1}{3}} \\
 &= 10^3 - 10^2 = 1000-100 =\boxed{900}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a = sqrt 1000000"
and h1 : "b = (1000000 powr (1/3))"
shows  "a - b = 900"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Find the difference between the square root of 1,000,000 and the cube root of 1,000,000. The final answer is 900.
